metadata.title: CVE-2022-26377 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request Smuggling')vulnerability in mod_proxy_ajp of Apache HTTP Server allows an attacker tosmuggle requests to the AJP server it forwards requests to. This issueaffects Apache HTTP Server Apache HTTP Server 2.4 version 2.4.53 and priorversions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26377` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24').
